sense.gloss: gold or silver lacquer, lacquer decoration sprinkled with metal powder
to scatter, to disseminate (e.g. a rumor), to spread (e.g. germs), to broadcast
to distribute widely (e.g. leaflets), to hand out freely, to spend recklessly
to sow, to plant, to seed
to sow (the seeds of; e.g. conflict)
to sprinkle (gold or silver powder on lacquerware)
sowing seeds, planting seeds, scattering seeds
scattering parched beans (to drive out evil spirits)

x: 遅まきながら・おそまきながら

sense.gloss: distributing widely, handing out freely, spending (money) recklessly
to sow the seeds of ... (e.g. conflict)
if you don't put in the effort, don't expect results, seeds you don't plant will never grow

k_ele.e: 権兵衛が種蒔きゃ烏がほじくる
権兵衛が種まきゃ烏がほじくる
権兵衛が種まきゃカラスがほじくる

r_ele.r: ごんべえがたねまきゃからすがほじくる
ごんべえがたねまきゃカラスがほじくる

sense.gloss: spoiling someone's work, useless effort, labouring in vain, if a peasant sows seeds, the crows will dig them up

sdata.j: ジョニーは４６↑年間↑↓ねんかん↓りんごの↑種子↑↓しゅし↓を↑蒔↑↓ま↓き↑付↑↓づ↓けた。
sdata.e: Johnny kept planting apple seeds for 46 years.

sdata.j: ↑蒔↑↓ま↓かぬ↑種↑↓しゅ↓は↑生↑↓は↓えない。
sdata.e: You must sow before you can reap.

sdata.j: ↑蒔↑↓ま↓かぬ↑種↑↓たね↓は↑生↑↓は↓えぬ。
↑農夫↑↓のうふ↓が↑畑↑↓はたけ↓に↑種↑↓たね↓を↑蒔↑↓ま↓いている。
sdata.e: The farmer is scattering seeds over the field.

sdata.j: ↑農民↑↓のうみん↓が↑穀物↑↓こくもつ↓の↑種↑↓たね↓を↑蒔↑↓ま↓いた。
sdata.e: The peasant scattered the seeds of grain.

sdata.j: ↑蒔↑↓ま↓かぬ↑種↑↓たね↓は↑生↑↓は↓えぬ。
sdata.e: No autumn fruit without spring blossom.

sdata.j: ↑蒔↑↓ま↓かぬ↑種↑↓たね↓は↑生↑↓は↓えぬ。
sdata.e: You cannot make an omelet without breaking eggs.

sdata.j: ↑蒔↑↓ま↓かぬ↑種↑↓たね↓は↑生↑↓は↓えぬ。
sdata.e: You can't make an omelette without breaking eggs.

sdata.j: ↑蒔↑↓ま↓かぬ↑種↑↓たね↓は↑生↑↓は↓えぬ。
sdata.e: You can't make an omelet without breaking eggs.

sdata.j: ↑蒔↑↓ま↓かぬ↑種↑↓たね↓は↑生↑↓は↓えぬ。
sdata.e: If you don't plant the seeds, they won't grow.

sdata.j: ↑春↑↓はる↓が↑来↑↓く↓ると、↑彼↑↓かれ↓らは↑畑↑↓はたけ↓を↑耕↑↓たがや↓し↑種↑↓しゅ↓を↑蒔↑↓ま↓く。
sdata.e: When spring comes, they plow the fields and plant seeds.

sdata.j: 「↑小↑↓ちい↓さい↑頃↑↓ころ↓に、お↑母↑↓かあ↓さんのお↑気↑↓き↓に↑入↑↓い↓りのネックレスをちぎちゃってさぁ、↑路上↑↓ろじょう↓にバラ↑蒔↑↓ま↓いたことがあるんだ」「お↑母↑↓かあ↓さんに、↑怒↑↓おこ↓られたでしょ？」「それがね、↑僕↑↓ぼく↓、↑覚↑↓おぼ↓えてないんだ」「じゃぁ、なんで↑知↑↓し↓ってるの？」「お↑母↑↓かあ↓さんに↑何↑↓なん↓↑度↑↓ど↓も↑言↑↓い↓われたから」「それって、↑絶対↑↓ぜったい↓お↑母↑↓かあ↓さんは↑根↑↓ね↓に↑持↑↓も↓ってるよね」「えっ。そうなのかな？」「↑多分↑↓たぶん↓ね。↑初任↑↓しょにん↓↑給↑↓きゅう↓もらったら、お↑母↑↓かあ↓さんにネックレスプレゼントしといた↑方↑↓ほう↓がいいよ」「わかった。そうする」
sdata.e: When I was little, I once broke my mom's favorite necklace, and all the little pieces spilled onto the road. "Was she mad at you?" "I don't really remember." "Then how do you know you did that?" "She told me about it several times." "She's probably holding it against you." "You think?" "Maybe. Once you start making money, you should buy her another one to make up for it." "Alright, I will."
